articles.title: Q1 2025 Staffing & Human Resources feat. ALTRES
articles.author: Our Advertising Partner
articles.summary: Michele Kauinui is the Director of HR Services at ALTRES. Her company works with clients to align HR strategies with organizational goals and recruit the best employees. AI has proven to be an important and viable tool in the world of HR.

articles.title: CES 2025: Robots and AI Want to Be Everywhere You Are
articles.author: CNET
articles.summary: Some of the most interesting AI-powered gadgets and services we've seen at this year's CES are listed below.      Â   i.e. from cute but bizarre to high-tech and practical, here are some of the interesting AI gadgets we've come across.

articles.title: Nvidia's new graphics cards double down on AI
articles.author: Timothy Green
articles.summary: Nvidia is the market leader in the gaming graphics card market. Its market share hovers above 80%, with AMD in a distant second place. Nvidia's new graphics cards can deliver twice the performance of their predecessors thanks to AI-powered features. The company has been able to fend off AMD and Intel in the market because of the broad support for Nvidia-specific features.

articles.title: Mount Sinai and Memorial Sloan Kettering advance AI tool for new cancer treatment
articles.author: Ethan Geringer-Sameth
articles.summary: The first immune checkpoint inhibitor therapy was approved by the Food and Drug Administration in 2011. Current methods of assessing patients' eligibility for the therapy require a tumor biopsy and complex genomic testing. The partners developed a predictive computer software known as Scorpio that could determine eligibility by tracing cell counts, enzymes, proteins and other particles in standard blood samples and clinical data in a patient's electronic medical records. The model was tested on data from 2,000 patients from Memorial Sloan Kettering and 2,100 from Mount Sinai.

articles.title: New AI predicts inner workings of cells
articles.author: Science Daily
articles.summary: In the same way that ChatGPT understands human language, a new AI model developed by computational biologists captures the language of cells to accurately predict their activities. It works in a similar way to the way that chatGPT works with human language. It can be used to predict the activities of cells.

articles.title: Investing $7,000 in Each of These 3 Artificial Intelligence Stocks a Year Ago Would Have Created a Portfolio Worth More Than $120,000 by the End of 2024
articles.author: David Jagielski
articles.summary: Palantir Technologies, SoundHound AI and Nvidia are some of the AI-related companies that have performed well in the last few years. If you had invested $7,000 into each of these stocks at the start of last year, you would have a portfolio worth more than $120,000 by the end of the year.

articles.title: Accenture CEO Julie Sweet asks new hires what they've learned in the last 6 months: ‘If they can't answer that question, we know they're not a learner'
articles.author: Ryan Hogg
articles.summary: Julie Sweet, CEO of Accenture, asks interviewees what they have learned in the last six months to determine if they are ready for the job. AI applications are at the top of most CEOs' agendas. LinkedIn's chief operating officer, Daniel Shapero, asks prospective hires how they used AI to determine whether they have the desire to learn the tech.

articles.title: 41% of companies worldwide plan to reduce workforces by 2030 due to AI
articles.author: Olesya Dmitracova
articles.summary: 41% of companies worldwide plan to reduce workforces by 2030 due to AI, according to WEF's Future of Jobs Report. Postal service clerks, executive secretaries and payroll clerks are among the fastest-declining job roles. 70% of businesses plan to hire more people with AI skills.

articles.title: SenseRobot Chess showcased at CES 2025
articles.author: Interesting Engineering
articles.summary: SenseRobot Chess was unveiled at CES 2025. It is an AI-powered chess robot that adapts to skill levels and offers precise gameplay. It can also be used as a training tool for tournaments. It was designed for enthusiasts and professionals alike. It's the future of chess.

articles.title: AI Restores the Voice of Israeli Journalist Moshe Nussbaum After ALS Diagnosis
articles.summary: Moshe Nussbaum, 71, was diagnosed with ALS two years ago. He lost his ability to speak clearly because of Lou Gehrig's disease. He used to work as a journalist for Israel's Channel 12 News for more than 40 years. Channel 12 will bring him back to the air in the coming weeks as a commentator with the help of artificial-intelligence software.

articles.title: Thread by @BotifydotCloud on Thread Reader App
articles.summary: Botify.Cloud is merging AI and blockchain to revolutionize automation with AI Agents. The company disrupts the SaaS industry and empowers anyone to build and launch AI-driven solutions. Botify is expanding into web2 and real-world automation with its groundbreaking plans for Physical AI.

articles.title: Google's DeepMind to Develop 'World Models' for Artificial General Intelligence
articles.author: Adrianna Nine
articles.summary: DeepMind is hiring AI researchers and engineers for the new project to develop "world models" that mimic the real world. The models play a significant role in Google's goal to develop artificial general intelligence before other tech giants. Once Google has AGI, it plans to use it to train robots, "cure" old AI training data and generate backdrops for movies and video games.

articles.title: Will AI transform how we travel?
articles.author: WNYW
articles.summary: Some people are using the technology to plan entire trips using artificial intelligence. FOX 5 NY's Jodi Goldberg shows us how some people are planning their trips using this technology and how it could take over some jobs in the travel industry in the near future.

articles.title: Did You Know? You Can Call 1-800-ChatGPT
articles.author: Matt Jancer
articles.summary: ChatGPT is an AI assistant developed by OpenAI. It's free and available on 1-800-Chat-GPT (1-242-8478). It's possible to talk to an audio-only version of ChatGPT for free. The conversation is lightly edited for clarity and brevity.

articles.title: Chick-fil-A's lemon-squeezing robots save 10,000 hours of labor per day
articles.author: Hans Bader
articles.summary: Chick-fil-A has hired robots to make lemonade in a factory north of Los Angeles. The factory uses 1.6 million pounds of lemons per year to make the lemonade. Chick-Fil-A is looking to add hundreds of new locations and deal with a labor shortage.

articles.title: PUBG will get AI-powered NPCs
articles.author: Anna Washenko
articles.summary: PUBG: Battlegrounds will add non-player characters powered by NVIDIA ACE generative AI. Krafton, the game's publisher, demoed this technology at CES 2025. It is also present in the multiplayer title Mecha BREAK and in upcoming life simulator inZOI.

articles.title: this is how the ford falcon of the future would look according to ai
articles.author: Romina Garcia
articles.summary: The Ford Falcon has been an icon in the automotive industry since its debut in 1960. Artificial intelligence envisions a future Ford Falcon with sleek aerodynamic lines and a lower profile, while maintaining its classic essence. Lightweight alloy wheels enhance performance and improve aerodynamic efficiency. Ergonomic seats are designed to offer maximum comfort on long journeys, while the advanced infotainment system keeps passengers connected. The hybrid engine combines power and efficiency and offers smooth and powerful acceleration.

articles.title: Man Who Exploded Tesla Cybertruck Outside Trump Hotel In Las Vegas Used ChatGPT To Plan Attack
articles.summary: Matthew Livelsberger used generative AI to help him plan the attack on a Tesla Cybertruck outside the Trump hotel in Las Vegas. The 37-year-old killed himself a week ago. He was an Army Green Beret who served in Afghanistan and Colorado Springs, Colorado.

articles.author: Tarah Buchan
articles.summary: Artificial intelligence has emerged as a powerful ally in academic preparation. AI tools and technologies offer innovative ways to enhance study efficiency, identify knowledge gaps, and provide personalized learning experiences. This guide explains how you can leverage AI to optimize your test preparation strategy and achieve better results.

articles.author: Andrew Tarantola
articles.summary: Microsoft has had to roll back its latest update to its Bing Image Generation system after users complained about a decline in image quality. The company's head of Search, Jordi Ribas, announced Tuesday that the company will revert Bing's underlying image generation model to the previous version until it can work out the quality issues.

OpenAI shut him down for violating its policies, which prohibit the use of its services to develop or use weapons.

Experts warn that advancements in artificial intelligence are making these scams more sophisticated and harder to detect. Governments, tech companies, and individuals must work together to stay ahead of scammers.

articles.author: Sarah Young
articles.summary: Ann Altman, 30, filed a lawsuit accusing Sam Altman of sexually abusing her regularly between 1997 and 2006. She is seeking at least $75,000 of damages, plus punitive damages, for alleged injuries including post-traumatic stress disorder, severe emotional distress, mental anguish and depression. Sam and other family members deny her claims and say it's difficult to care for her.

The suit was filed in Missouri, the site of the Altmans' childhood home, where the alleged abuse took place from 1997 to 2006. Ann is seeking a sum in excess of $75,000 for punitive damages and the cost of the suit. Sam's family responded to the suit on X.

articles.title: Night Driving Challenges in Autonomous Driving Addressed by Imagry with ADASKY Collaboration

It addresses challenging night driving conditions to expand the performance of self-driving vehicles and improves safety by providing more time to respond in adverse visibility conditions.

The order notes that AI technologies are 'already being utilized by state agencies' and directs actions to build a framework for AI's responsible use. The technology department is also tasked with coordinating with state agencies and the private sector to develop a set of statewide AI policy recommendations.

articles.title: Mississippi governor signs executive order on AI
articles.author: Tia McKenzie
articles.summary: Governor Tate Reeves signed an executive order on Wednesday to foster stakeholder collaboration and harness artificial intelligence (AI) in Mississippi. The order directs the Mississippi Department of Information Technology Services to conduct an inventory of all AI technologies being planned, piloted, acquired, developed, and/or utilized by each state agency. It also directs ITS to develop policy recommendations for the agency's responsible use of AI.

articles.summary: Artificial intelligence and humans can both be biased. Bias from AI systems could be more impactful than bias from clinicians. articles.summary: Natural language IVR is an automated system that allows callers to speak in a conversational, free-form way to interact with the system using speech recognition and AI to understand and process requests. articles.title: MS Gov. Tate Reeves signs executive order on artificial intelligence in state agencies

Tate Reeves signed Executive Order 1584 on Wednesday, Jan. 8, 2025 regarding artificial intelligence at a press conference at the Woolfolk State Office Building in Jackson, Miss., on Wednesday. It directs the Mississippi Department of Information Technology Services to conduct an inventory of all A.I. technologies being planned, being piloted, being developed and/or being utilized by each and every state agency. It also directs the department to coordinate with state agencies to develop policy recommendations for the agencies.

The biggest benefit for small businesses using AI is getting ahead in the race for talent. Small businesses with gen AI are 45% more likely to fill open roles.

Early adopters like Uber, Waabi, and Agility are leveraging Cosmos for autonomous mobility, data curation and robot training.
